distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for glusterfs is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
GlusterFS is a key building block of Red Hat Gluster Storage. It is based on a stackable user-space design and can deliver exceptional performance for diverse workloads. GlusterFS aggregates various storage servers over network interconnections into one large, parallel network file system.

The following packages have been upgraded to a later upstream version: glusterfs (3.12.2). (BZ#1579734)

Security Fix(es):

* glusterfs: Improper deserialization in dict.c:dict_unserialize() can allow attackers to read arbitrary memory (CVE-2018-10911)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Red Hat would like to thank Michael Hanselmann (hansmi.ch) for reporting this issue.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.6 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: glusterfs security, bug fix, and enhancement update

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: A flaw was found in dict.c:dict_unserialize function of glusterfs, dic_unserialize function does not handle negative key length values. An attacker could use this flaw to read memory from other locations into the stored dict value.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: glusterfs: Improper deserialization in dict.c:dict_unserialize() can allow attackers to read arbitrary memory
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw affects glusterfs versions included in Red Hat Virtualization 4 Hypervisor. However, in recommended configurations, the vulnerability is only exposed to hypervisor administrators and can not be exploited from virtual machines or other hosts on the network. For Red Hat Virtualization, Product Security has rated this flaw as Moderate. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: glusterfs: Improper deserialization in dict.c:dict_unserialize() can allow attackers to read arbitrary memory
